page.title: 05Sunday in Clayton-le-Woods
page.content: On a Sunday in Clayton-le-Woods we get up early and get ready to go to church to sing to God. Most christenings are held on Sunday to celebrate the baby as a Christian and part of the family. We sing to God to thank him for the world we live on and share. We also thank God for food and drink without them we would not live. After church we go home for our Sunday dinner. For dinner on Sunday we have roast potatoes, lamb, boiled potatoes, peas, carrots, cabbage or cauliflower with gravy poured all over them. When we have finished our dinner we go out for a ride in the car. When we come home it is nearly our bed-time so we get ready for bed then go to sleep
